guideline.name: Annotation of CPIC Guideline for desflurane, enflurane, halothane, isoflurane, methoxyflurane, sevoflurane, succinylcholine and CACNA1S

relatedGenes.name: calcium voltage-gated channel subunit alpha1 S

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166304126

text.html: Clinical findings, family history, further genetic testing and other laboratory data should guide use of halogenated volatile anesthetics or depolarizing muscle relaxants.

implications: These results do not eliminate the chance that this patient is susceptible to Malignant Hyperthermia. The genetic cause of about half of all MH survivors, with MH susceptibility confirmed by contracture test, remains unknown (PMID: 28902675).

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166304073

text.html:
Halogenated volatile anesthetics or the depolarizing muscle relaxant succinylcholine are relatively contraindicated in persons with malignant hyperthermia susceptibility (MHS). They should not be used, except in extraordinary circumstances where the benefits outweigh the risks. In general, alternative anesthetics are widely available and effective in patients with MHS.

A list of unsafe halogenated volatile anesthetics or depolarizing muscle relaxants and alternative anesthetics can be found at http://www.mhaus.org/healthcare-professionals/be-prepared/safe-and-unsafe-anesthetics.

implications: Individuals are at increased risk of developing malignant hyperthermia if administered halogenated volatile anesthetics or the depolarizing muscle relaxant succinylcholine.

citations.title: Clinical Pharmacogenetics Implementation Consortium (CPIC) Guideline for the Use of Potent Volatile Anesthetic Agents and Succinylcholine in the Context of RYR1 or CACNA1S Genotypes.
